pull.title: Fixed dead ISO link
pull.body:
- Link to Debian 8.1 netinstall ISO is dead, changed to valid 8.2
- Changed checksum to 8.2 netinstall ISO checksum (http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/SHA256SUMS)
- Verified CD checksum, checksum file's signing key

events.message:
Fixed dead link

- Link to Debian 8.1 netinstall ISO is dead, changed to valid 8.2
- Changed checksum to 8.2 netinstall ISO checksum (http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/SHA256SUMS)
- Verified CD checksum, checksum file's signing key

events.body:
Have you run through the gitian guide and checked it doesn't need any
changes for 8.2?

On Friday, September 11, 2015, unsystemizer notifications@github.com
wrote:

> - Link to Debian 8.1 netinstall ISO is dead, changed to valid 8.2
> - Changed checksum to 8.2 netinstall ISO checksum (
>   http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/SHA256SUMS)
> - Verified CD checksum, checksum file's signing key
> 
> ---
> 
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
> 
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661
> Commit Summary
> - Fixed dead link
> 
> File Changes
> - _M_ doc/gitian-building.md
>   https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661/files#diff-0 (4)
> 
> Patch Links:
> - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661.patch
> - https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661.diff
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661.

- I submitted a PR before making sure of that because the page says that any newer minor version should do as well. 
- The instructions are buggy, so I haven't yet managed to complete the process (I got to the point where I'm supposed to build Bitcoin Core binaries). It seems the instructions should be fixed/changed in any case. 

I'll confirm once I manage to complete the procedure using Deb 8.2.
If you've found a problem with the guide please open an issue so it can be looked at.
Right, I'm going to do that as I make progress understanding the process. The guide is quite comprehensive (KVM, LXC, VirtualBox, etc.) so I hope to make another PR at a later time.
Great. Once you do get up and running, sigs are always welcome at https://github.com/bitcoin/gitian.sigs
Tested ACK once nits addressed. I've run through the guide and built all sigs with 8.2
@MarcoFalke what typo nits? It looks ok to me at first glance.
@unsystemizer  @btcdrak https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6661/files#r39330329 The link is updated but the text is not (still says 8.1)
Was taking too long, I updated the version number and merged via 551d7ed

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -74,11 +74,11 @@ In the VirtualBox GUI click "Create" and choose the following parameters in the
 - File location and size: at least 40GB; as low as 20GB *may* be possible, but better to err on the safe side 
 - Click `Create`
 
-Get the [Debian 8.1 net installer](http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.1.0/amd64/iso-cd/debian-8.1.0-amd64-netinst.iso) (a more recent minor version should also work, see also [Debian Network installation](https://www.debian.org/CD/netinst/)).
+Get the [Debian 8.1 net installer](http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/debian-8.2.0-amd64-netinst.iso) (a more recent minor version should also work, see also [Debian Network installation](https://www.debian.org/CD/netinst/)).

@@ -74,11 +74,11 @@ In the VirtualBox GUI click "Create" and choose the following parameters in the
 - File location and size: at least 40GB; as low as 20GB *may* be possible, but better to err on the safe side 
 - Click `Create`
 
-Get the [Debian 8.1 net installer](http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.1.0/amd64/iso-cd/debian-8.1.0-amd64-netinst.iso) (a more recent minor version should also work, see also [Debian Network installation](https://www.debian.org/CD/netinst/)).
+Get the [Debian 8.1 net installer](http://cdimage.debian.org/debian-cd/8.2.0/amd64/iso-cd/debian-8.2.0-amd64-netinst.iso) (a more recent minor version should also work, see also [Debian Network installation](https://www.debian.org/CD/netinst/)).
comments.body: If these are available via https, then please let's use that.

comments.body:
Agreed,  however https://www.debian.org/CD/ seems to stipulate that you cannot download these over `HTTPS`.
Which is probably why we have a SHA256 below.
